smartSelectFullWords.wordRangeRegex.description: The regular expression used to get the word range (via vscode's getWordRangeAtPosition API). This regex must be stateless, as vscode applies it iteratively on 15-character chunks of text. The result is then tested against wordRegex (which can be stateful).

smartSelectFullWords.resultRegex.description: The regular expression applied to the result of the wordRangeRegex. If it matches, the match will be smart selected.
smartSelectFullWords.resultRegex.//: This matches words with dashes, as well as tailwind syntax: foo-bar/50, foo-bar/[0.2], foo-bar-[baz_qux(jib)]

smartSelectFullWords.selectImmediately.description: When enabled, matching words are selected immediately (bypassing selection of smaller words) when using the `smartSelectFullWords.expandSelection` command. After running that command with this setting, you can still get to the smaller selection by using the builtin Shrink Selection command.
